verses.verse: Dead <S%H4194><s%> flies <S%H2070><s%> cause the oil <S%H8081><s%> of the perfumer <S%H7543><s%> to send forth <S%H5042><s%> an evil odor; <S%H887><s%> so does a little <S%H4592><s%> folly <S%H5531><s%> outweigh <S%H3368><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and honor. <S%H3519><s%>
A wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s heart <S%H3820><s%> is at his right hand, <S%H3225><s%> but a fool <S%H3684><s%>'s heart <S%H3820><s%> at his left. <S%H8040><s%>

Yes also, <S%H5530><s%> when the fool walks <S%H1980><s%> by the way, <S%H1870><s%> his understanding <S%H3820><s%> fails <S%H2638><s%> him, <S%H559><s%> and he says to everyone that he is a fool. <S%H5530><s%>

If the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the ruler <S%H4910><s%> rises up <S%H5927><s%> against you, <S%H3240><s%> don't leave your place; <S%H4725><s%> for gentleness <S%H4832><s%> lays <S%H3240><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> offenses to rest. <S%H2399><s%>

There is <S%H3426><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under the sun, <S%H8121><s%> the sort of error <S%H7684><s%> which proceeds <S%H3318><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the ruler. <S%H7989><s%>
Folly <S%H5529><s%> is set <S%H5414><s%> in great <S%H7227><s%> dignity, <S%H4791><s%> and the rich <S%H6223><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> in a low place. <S%H8216><s%>
I have seen <S%H7200><s%> servants <S%H5650><s%> on horses, <S%H5483><s%> and princes <S%H8269><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> like servants <S%H5650><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%>
He who digs <S%H2658><s%> a pit <S%H1475><s%> may fall <S%H5307><s%> into it; <S%H6555><s%> and whoever breaks through a wall <S%H1447><s%> may be bitten <S%H5391><s%> by a snake. <S%H5175><s%>
Whoever carves out <S%H5265><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> may be injured <S%H6087><s%> by them. <S%H1234><s%> Whoever splits wood <S%H6086><s%> may be endangered thereby. <S%H5533><s%>

If the axe <S%H1270><s%> is blunt, <S%H6949><s%> and one doesn't <S%H7043><s%> sharpen the edge, <S%H6440><s%> then he must use <S%H1396><s%> more strength; <S%H2428><s%> but skill <S%H2451><s%> brings <S%H3787><s%> success. <S%H3504><s%>
If the snake <S%H5175><s%> bites <S%H5391><s%> before it is charmed, <S%H3908><s%> then is there no profit <S%H3504><s%> for the charmer <S%H3956><s%>'s tongue.
The words <S%H1697><s%> of a wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s mouth <S%H6310><s%> are gracious; <S%H2580><s%> but a fool <S%H3684><s%> is swallowed <S%H1104><s%> by his own lips. <S%H8193><s%>

The beginning <S%H8462><s%> of the words <S%H1697><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> is foolishness; <S%H5531><s%> and the end <S%H319><s%> of his talk <S%H6310><s%> is mischievous <S%H7451><s%> madness. <S%H1948><s%>

A fool <S%H5530><s%> also multiplies <S%H7235><s%> words. <S%H1697><s%> Man <S%H120><s%> doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know what will be; <S%H310><s%> and that which will be after him, <S%H5046><s%> who can tell him?
The labor <S%H5999><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> wearies <S%H3021><s%> every one of them; <S%H3045><s%> for he doesn't know how to go <S%H3212><s%> to the city. <S%H5892><s%>
Woe <S%H337><s%> to you, <S%H776><s%> land, when your king <S%H4428><s%> is a child, <S%H5288><s%> and your princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in the morning! <S%H1242><s%>

Happy <S%H835><s%> are you, <S%H776><s%> land, when your king <S%H4428><s%> is the son <S%H1121><s%> of nobles, <S%H2715><s%> and your princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in due season, <S%H6256><s%> for strength, <S%H1369><s%> and not for drunkenness! <S%H8358><s%>
By slothfulness <S%H6103><s%> the roof <S%H4746><s%> sinks <S%H4355><s%> in; <S%H8220><s%> and through idleness of the hands <S%H3027><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> leaks. <S%H1811><s%>
A feast <S%H3899><s%> is made <S%H6213><s%> for laughter, <S%H7814><s%> and wine <S%H3196><s%> makes the life glad; <S%H8055><s%> and money <S%H3701><s%> is the answer for all things. <S%H6030><s%>

Don't <S%H7043><s%> curse the king, <S%H4428><s%> no, <S%H4093><s%> not in your thoughts; and don't <S%H7043><s%> curse the rich <S%H6223><s%> in your bedroom: <S%H2315><s%> for a bird <S%H5775><s%> of the sky <S%H8064><s%> may carry <S%H3212><s%> your voice, <S%H6963><s%> and that which has <S%H1167><s%> wings <S%H3671><s%> may tell <S%H5046><s%> the matter. <S%H1697><s%>
